title.rendered: Law Students Recognised for Contributions to LAWS

content.rendered:
The efforts of LAWS law student volunteers from both of our partner law schools have been recognized over recent months!

LAWS congratulates the outstanding achievements of the Osgoode Hall Law School 2012 Dean’s Gold Key Awards recepients. Among the twelve graduating students who received recognition for their fantastic contribution to the life of the law school, were Joseph Hoffman, David Shellnut, and Stephanie Marple, each of whom volunteered their time and contributed to the success of the launch of LAWS in the Jane-Finch community over the past year.

At the University of Toronto, we congratulate graduating students Renatta Austin and Justin Basinger who were awarded 2012 University of Toronto T Gordon Cressy Student Leadership Awards for their efforts which included significant contributions to LAWS.

We thank these students and all of our law student volunteers for their contributions to LAWS and to the life and community of our partner law schools.
